Subject: RE: Follow Up Call

(USANYS)" 
No worries. I just dialed in. I don't think anyone is on the line yet. Let me know if you are and I just am not using this 
properly. 
From:

To 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
(USANYS) 
Apologies, I'm stuck on a call running a  few minutes behind, but I'll dial in momentarily. 
Thanks,

Sent: Friday, May 7, 2021 12:56 PM 
To: 
c> 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
(USANYS) 
In advance of our call, attached is an article that recently ran locally on this issue: 
From 
Sent: Wednesday, May 5, 2021 9:26 AM 
To: 
sce 
Cc: (USANYS) ‹> 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
I have asked my PIO to find out if there is a deadline on this reporting that will necessitate moving up the timing of this 
call. I will let you know if that turns out to be the case. 
Below are the details for the conference call in number and participant code: 
EFTA00019183

Phone Number: 866-880-0098 
Participant code: 8704649# 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, May 5, 20218:29 AM 
To: 
Cc: >; (USANYS) 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
Thanks for the advanced notice, we should definitely discuss, particularly since there are rules about press contacts in our 
pending case that we're mindful of. 2:15 p.m. works for us. On timing, do you have a sense of when you anticipate this 
happening? 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, May 5, 2021 10:21 AM 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
(USANYS) 
As an FYI, I am really calling to get the contact information for your PIO since there will be reporting in our local news and 
my USA wants to make a statement, but we want to run this by you all and your PIO first. As for time, does 2:15pm ET 
work for you all? If so, I can get a conference line set up for that time. 
H

possible. Could we pick a time on Friday afternoon and use a conference line? 
Thanks,

as I will likely be working remotely. 
No worries about the delay. I know that it is especially difficult to keep all the balls in the air right now. I am fairly sure I 
am dropping some as I type this email. I can do a call on Thursday at 1pm MT/ 3Pm ET. Should I call the office number 
listed in your signature block below?

Sent: Monday, July 20, 2020 4:51 PM 
cfl

EFTA00019185

Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
Apologies for the delay, and thank you for following up. I am available for a call any time after 1 p.m. Eastern on 
Thursday 7/23. Please let me know if there is a  convenient time for a call that afternoon. 
Thanks, 
Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
I  St. Andrew's Plaza 
New York, NY 10007 
From: 
Sent: Monday, July 20, 2020 6:40 PM 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
All-
I  am just following up on the below email request for a brief phone call. Please let me know when you have availability. 
From 
Sent: Wednesday, July 15, 2020 8:41 AM 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
Greetings from DNM, 
Well done on the new indictment against Ms. Maxwell. We were pleased to see that conduct in New Mexico formed the 
basis of one of your overt acts. I know that you all are very busy, but if you a moment for a brief call to discuss the 
impact, if any, of the new indictment on seizure/forfeiture of Epstein's NM property, I would appreciate it. As you are 
aware, this is an issue my US Attorney, John Anderson, has asked me to track. 
Thanks,

Angeles

From 
Sent: Friday, October 11, 2019 1:25 PM 
To: 
Subject: RE: Follow 
Up Call 
When we last spoke, you expressed a willingness to review New Mexico-specific questions that we would like to be 
included in future interviews of Epstein victims. While I am certain that you already cover the pertinent questions, we 
did not want to turn down the invitation to submit a set of proposed questions, which I have attached. 
EFTA00019188

I hope all is well with you and the ongoing investigation. As we mentioned on the phone, we are here to assist with any 
investigation into New Mexico-related matters, including the submission of any application for a search warrant. 
Best, 
From: 
Se 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
You can call my desk at 
Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
I  St. Andrew's Plaza 
007 
Fro 
Sent: Monday, September 9, 2019 11:27 AM 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
Thank you for the response and the additional information about the NM AG's office. We look forward to speaking with 
you on Thursday. What number should we call? 
Thanks, 
From: 
Sent: Sunda , Se tember 08, 2019 3:15 PM 
To 
< > 
Cc: < > 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
EFTA00019189

H 
Yes, a call on 9/12 at 1:30 MT / 3:30 ET will work for us, thanks very much. 
As a preview in response t email, we spoke with the New Mexico AG's office back in July 2019. In essence, 
they agreed to cease any i gau n nto sex trafficking and share whatever they had gathered to date regarding sex 
trafficking activity with our office. We agreed that they were free to proceed with whatever other investigations 
(unrelated to sex trafficking) they may have concerning Epstein and told them that at the conclusion of our case, we 
would pass along any information we may have gathered about state crimes that were committed in their jurisdiction. 
We have not communicated with anyone from the New Mexico AG's office since that conversation in July 2019. 
Best, 
Assistant United States Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
I  St. Andrew's Plaza 
Fron

Subject: RE: Follow 
Up Call 
I just wanted to confirm that you all are able to do the phone call next Thursday, September 12th at 1:30 MT / 3:30 ET? 
Please let me know what number we should call. 
Thanks, 
From: 
S 
T 
- I ill !Ste 1:1,/b.74•1(4 1:11/411.8 n 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
FYI: state authorities in New Mexico are moving forward with their own plans with respect to the Epstein property. 
Yesterday the state land commissioner revoked leases held by Cypress Inc. 
https://www.abqjournal.com/1362185/land-commissioner-voids-epsteins-nm-grazing-leases.html 
The linked news coverage quotes the New Mexico Attorney General as saying that he is conducting a criminal 
investigation at the state level "in coordination with" the SDNY. Here are a few sentences from late in the article: 
EFTA00019190

The [State] Attorney General's Office is investigating whether crimes took place on Zorro Ranch. [State Land 
Commissioner Stephanie] Garcia Richard said Wednesday her office had notified [State] Attorney General 
Hector Balderas to provide notice if any criminal activity was found to have occurred on the trust land leased 
by Epstein "because we were looking for a reason to cancel these leases and criminal activity would have given 
us the perfect reason." 
Balderas did issue a statement saying he was pleased Garcia Richard was "taking back lands that should be 
managed to best serve the State and for the benefit of New Mexico school children." Public schools are one 
beneficiary of state trust land revenue. Balderas added: "We continue to investigate this matter at the state level 
in coordination with U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York." 
Jonathon 
Fraud and Public Corruption Section 
Fro

Hope you're doing well. This week is a bit tough for us. Are there dates next week that would work for you? We are 
traveling Monday through Wednesday, but could talk Thursday or Friday. 
Thanks, 
EFTA00019191

nd I were hoping to schedule a follow up call with you concerning Epstein's New Mexico conduct and 
proper y sometime this week. We are both available tomorrow morning (9-12 MT / 11-2 ET) or Friday any time after 
12pm MT / 2pm ET. Do you all have availability for a follow up call on either of these days? 
Thanks, 
From: 
Sent: Saturday, August 17, 2019 12:46 PM 
To: Kastrin, Holland S. (USANM) 
<HKastrinPusa.doLgov>
Cc: 
) <>; 
Subject: RE: Follow Up Call 
> 
We certainly can be in touch. I'm copying my colleagues on the case, Alison and Maurene, because I have a trial starting 
August 26 so I'll be mostly unavailable next week, but it should be possible to find a  time for one or both of them to 
chat. If you send a couple possible times for next week we can figure it out. 
thanks, 
From: 
K 
Sent: Friday, August 16, 2019 14:01 
To: 
Subject: Follow Up 
Call 
Would you have a couple of minutes to chat with me and one of my colleagues about some NM-related Epstein matters 
this afternoon or early next week? If today works for you, I am available any time after 1:30 MT/ 3:30 ET today. It is 
nothing urgent. 
Thanks, 
EFTA00019192
